moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. a3 Bxc3: Cutting across Black's normal play on the white squares with the idea of establishing a dynamic position in the center.
moves.6... O-O 7. e4 e5: Denied access to the white squares, he has to make what he can of the black.
moves.8. Bd3 Nc6: Inviting P-Q5 when the weakness of the doubled pawns would be emphasized and his access to the black squares would be increased. White resists the bait.
moves.9. Ne2 Nd7 10. O-O b6 11. Be3 Ba6 12. Ng: The energy in White's center begins to make itself felt.
moves.14... f6 15. Rf3 Kh8 16. Raf1 Qf7: Forcing White at last to admit the threat to his doubled pawn.
moves.17. fxe5 dxe5 18. d5 Nb7: At once shifting his focus onto the weakened black squares.
moves.19. Nf5 Nd6 20. Rh3 g6: Taking steps against White's outpost, but the maneuver gives White further weaknesses to exploit.
moves.21. Nh6 Qg7 22. g4 g5: He is once more forced to concede the outpost square and has a weak KB pawn into the bargain.
moves.23. Rh5 Nc5 24. Bxc5 bxc5: Preventing any frontal attack on White's doubled pawns and leaving Black also with doubled pawns.
Not 29 RxNP B-Q2 and the Rook is trapped.
moves.29... Bd7 30. Rhg3: Preparing the advance of his KR pawn.
moves.30... Be8 31. h4 gxh4 32. Rg2 h3: The pawn cannot be held, and giving it up this way interferes with White's build-up against the KB pawn.
moves.33. Rxh3 Bg6 34. Rf3 Rab8: Having established his defensive position, Black prepares to counterattack on the Q side.
moves.35. Qh4 Rb3 36. Rgf2 Rxc3: Black has won the doubled pawn after all, but at the cost of allowing White a devastating attack.
moves.37. g5 Ne8 38. gxf6 Qd8: If 38... Q-Q3, 39 P-B7 N-N2 40 R-B6 increases the pressure.
moves.39. Ng4 Rxd3: If ...Q-Q2, 40 Q-N5 still wins the KP.
moves.40. Rxd3 Bxe4 41. Re3 Nd6 42. Nxe5 Bf5: Hoping to win the dangerous White KB pawn at last, but a drastic finish follows. Black no doubt thought the Bishop was taboo because of the resulting fork.
moves.43. Rxf5 Nxf5 44. Ng6+ Kg8 45. Re7: A beautiful move. If 45... NxQ, 46 R-N7 mate. If 45... PxN, 46 Q-R7 mate. If 45 ... NxR, 46 PxN Q-K1 47 PxR (Q) ch wins easily.
Black resigns. If 48.. QxBP to stop 49 Q-R8 mate, 49 N-Q7 ch wins the Q.
